Notes: Single-seat variant with Raven ES-05 AESA radar (250 km detection), fly-by-wire, and 6 Meteor/AIM-120D missiles for high-Pk BVR; MS20 upgrades (complete 2025) add AI targeting; F 7 Skaraborg at Såtenäs, excels in networked ops with Erieye cueing to 150 km envelope.
Two-seat with identical Raven ES-05 radar and 4-6 Meteor loads for tactics/cooperative BVR; supports two-ship formations and ELINT fusion; integrated with Gripen E for hybrid NATO exercises.

Enhanced single-seat with GaN AESA (300 km range), internal bays for 6 Meteor, and reduced RCS for first-shot BVR; 7 more delivered in 2025 toward 60 total; F 21 Luleå, boosts stealthy 160 km engagements via GlobalEye.

Erieye AESA radar (450 km horizon) for off-board targeting and mid-course Meteor updates; sole operational unit post-Ukraine donation; F 17 at Kallinge, critical kill-chain enabler for Gripen salvos in Baltic theater.
Advanced AEW with Erieye ER AESA (550 km) for extended cueing and missile guidance; first delivery 2027, replacing Saab 340; enhances BVR to 170 km with multi-domain fusion for Gripen E ops.
ELINT suite (300 km sensors) for enemy radar detection/jamming, enabling BVR "permission to shoot"; F 17 at Kallinge, supports Gripen by degrading IADS in contested airspace.
C-130H variant with probe refueling for 1.5+ hour BVR extensions on Gripen; sole tanker at F 16 Uppsala, enables sustained patrols despite limited numbers, integrated with Erieye for Arctic ops.
MRTT with boom/probe for 3+ hour BVR sustainment; 2 slots in multinational fleet (8 nations); supports Gripen interoperability in NATO exercises, extending envelopes to 150 km.
